thread.title: Son finds pensioner dad savaged to death with arms and legs "shredded to pieces" by five vicious dogs
thread.title_full: Son finds pensioner dad savaged to death with arms and legs "shredded to pieces" by five vicious dogs

author: mirror
title: Son finds pensioner dad savaged to death with arms and legs "shredded to pieces" by five vicious dogs
text:
News Son finds pensioner dad savaged to death with arms and legs "shredded to pieces" by five vicious dogs The 66-year-old was found with teeth marks everywhere after the shocking incident during which he'd tried to defend himself until his last breath Share Handout image from police of caged Pitbulls (Photo: Guardia Civil) Share Get daily   Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
A pensioner reportedly savaged to death by five vicious dogs in a horrific attack that left his arms and legs "shredded to pieces" was found by his son after failing to return from a walk. 
The 66-year-old man had bites on his head and face and "teeth marks everywhere" after the attack by the animals, which allegedly included several Pit bulls. 
Police said it was clear he had tried to put up a fight and attempted to defend himself "until his last breath". 
The animals attacked the pensioner on his own land after apparently escaping from a next door neighbour's rural property in Alicante, on Spain's southeastern Costa Blanca. 
Shocked police said the victim's arms and legs had been "shredded to pieces" and he had bites on his head and face when he was found by his son in an orchard. The shocking dog attack happened in Beniarbeig, Alicante (Photo: Google) Read More Dad-of-two died from bite he got while freeing his springer spaniel from the jaws of another dog 
He was said to have "teeth marks everywhere" and had tried to shield himself from the vicious attack". 
A police spokesman said: "He had obviously put up a fierce fight and had tried to defend himself to his last breath." 
The man's son had gone out to look for his father after he went for a walk but had not returned several hours later. A man was reportedly savaged to death by a group of dogs in Beniarbeig, Alicante (Photo: Google) 
The shocking incident happened in the town of Beniarbeig and involved dogs classified as "potentially dangerous breeds", including Pit bulls and Bull Terriers which are subject to strict controls, including muzzles. Read More 
Police said only one of the dogs had a microchip which is part of the legislation. 
The owner allegedly had no paperwork for them and no authorisations to own such breeds. 
The dogs were taken to an animal shelter but overnight are reported to have savaged their cages and bitten a caretaker. 
Investigations are continuing, including taking DNA tests from the dogs, but the owner could face a charge of reckless homicide. 
He is denying responsibility.
